sources.title: "Thomas Graal's Best Child" (1918)
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems   This is a short preview. You can watch the whole film here: https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/index.php/gems-for-donation   "Thomas Graal's Best Child" is a Swedish comedy starring Victor Sjöström (Seastrom), a star of Silent Hall of Fame.     A man feels neglected by his wife after the birth of their child and hatches a plan to win back her attention.     The film is a sequel to "Thomas Graal's Best Film" (1917), which is also a part of our Silent Gems Collection. The film is directed by Finnish-born director Mauritz Stiller, who had distinguished careers both in Sweden and in the USA, where he was recognized with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame for his contributions. The male star in the film Victor Sjöström was also building a successful directing career at the time, and it was in this capacity that he excelled in later years, including a stellar career in the USA. Directed by                          Mauritz Stiller Produced by                        Swedish Biograpg Co. Scenario by                          Gustaf Molander Cinematography                Henrik Jaenzon Starring                                Victor Sjöström, Karin Molander, Josef Fischer, Jenny Tschernichin-Larsson, Axel Nilsson Release date                         October 21, 1918 Running time                       73 min.
